metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14345 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in X.Org Server before xorg-x11-server 1.20.9. AnOut-Of-Bounds access in XkbSetNames function may lead to a privilegeescalation vulnerability. The highest threat from this vulnerability is todata confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xdmx-tools - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xnest - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xorg-server-source - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xserver-common - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xvfb - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
xwayland - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10
No subscription required

xmir-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
xorg-server-source-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
xserver-xephyr-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
xwayland-hwe-16.04 - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.10').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.1~16.04.4').
